pr_title: Feature/workflow GitHub app and yaml support

timeline.message: endpoint for adding a workflow from GitHub install
new endpoint for handling release calls from GitHub App
added comments; removed some old code; some reorg of new code
can add test parameter files to dockstoreyml
remove old service code; handle dockstore.yml versions
fix remainder of tests that were failing
moved check user exists to later in the flow
started tests for dockore yml and workflows
updated sync services endpoint to also work with workflows
added webhook test for no user on dockstore
workflow and service now have subclass of descriptor types (optional)
update test for dockstore yml refresh
change sync for services to be sync with github
more changes to sync, removed old tests
fix check for subclass for 1.1 services, looks for type instead
sync with github now returns workflows and services
added more values to descriptor language subclass
field does not have required or allowableValues (use enum); also some codacy stuff

timeline.bodyText: Doubled-comment
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: friendly name and short names aren't too different here, would recommend just picking one
timeline.author: denis-yuen

+package io.dockstore.common;
+
+import java.util.Arrays;
+import java.util.Optional;
+
+public enum DescriptorLanguageSubclass {
+    DOCKER_COMPOSE("Docker Compose", "docker-compose"),
+    HELM("Helm", "helm"),
+    SWARM("Swarm", "swarm"),
+    KUBERNETES("Kubernetes", "kubernetes");
+
+    private final String friendlyName;
+
+    private final String shortName;
+
+    DescriptorLanguageSubclass(final String friendlyName, final String shortName) {
+        this.friendlyName = friendlyName;

timeline.bodyText: Ditto, its probably an IDE config issue
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: @Operation has a nested @ApiResponse that can describe response codes. For that matter, these should described in OpenAPI
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Refresh my memory from the presentation, why are duplicates not a concern with the new approach?
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: It is more so that this test assumes that service stubs exist which is no longer the case.
replies.author: agduncan94

replies.bodyText: If the workflow already exists on Dockstore in the new model, one will not be created, but a new version will be added.
replies.author: agduncan94

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer this to be non-nullable and just set to a n/a term or similar by default.
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: Would I have a subclass called not applicable?
replies.author: agduncan94

timeline.bodyText: Can get rid of this kind of thing and error prone null checks
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: initializeWorkflow can be more descriptive if this is for github app installs only
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Use https://github.com/dockstore/dockstore/blob/develop/dockstore-common/src/main/java/io/dockstore/common/DescriptorLanguage.java#L146 or similar so that we don't need to touch this when we need to get Galaxy in here too.
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Ditto
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: This can use https://github.com/dockstore/dockstore/pull/3235/files#diff-fd5ac5b6f6fdba95c1c5be457e049d7dR207 after my merge
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Non descriptive variable names
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Please write a test with a 1.1 and 1.2 schema file checked-in. I think we can make some quick decisions to make 1.2 support both and be compatible (i.e. can switch the version number from 1.1 to 1.2 to "upgrade", a 1.2 file can be read as a 1.1 file since your new keys should just be ignored)
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: I do have tests for schema 1.1 for services and 1.2 for workflows. Do you mean have one a test that has both 1.1 and 1.2 services? I was hoping that the 1.2 services could be added in the next PR since I didn't want this one getting too big.
replies.author: agduncan94

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if the name should have something to indicate workflow in it? What if we add support for tools and dockstore.yml?

timeline.bodyText: If you come in here, don't you want to thrown an exception? Otherwise it will go ahead and create the workflow on line 369.

replies.bodyText: I am pretty sure nextflow does not yet (or at least at the time) have checker workflow implementation.

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we shouldn't have OTHER as well. The service definition is pretty agnostic to the technology. But I'm not sure what anybody would do with OTHER, so I'm torn.
